intro: Lonchocarpus isthmensis, commonly known as the Isthmus legume, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes characterized by their pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are compound, with oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces distinctive yellow or orange flowers. The seeds are enclosed in elongated, woody pods, which are a key feature of the genus Lonchocarpus.
